answers.author: Stephanie Klinkenberger
answers.text:
The City of Virginia Beach, VA has a staff person in the City Manager's Office that acts as the liaison for two lobbyists.  The lobbyists are paid consultants.  One works in the state legislature and one represents the city at the federal level.  When legislation is proposed that may impact any city department the lobbyist will in form the liaison who sends the information to the appropriate city department head.
Hope this helps!

answers.author: Thomas Couch
answers.text:
In Bulloch County, Georgia we have a pre- and post-legislative legislative review process focused upon our state General Assembly which is part-time and generally meets from Jan.-Apr. During post-review, we have a management intern disseminate information to division directors and department heads conerning new or amended laws and state budget issues that may affect our programs or sevices. During the interim, County Commissioners and myself attend policy conferences during the summer sponsored by the Association of County Commissioners in Georgia (ACCG) to hear and discuss further impacts and the prospects for upcoming bills. The management intern then performs a pre-legislative review in the fall where we use a survey instrument and then caucus again with division/department heads to develop a legislative platform to present to our local delegation, or as appropriate or necessary, ACCG or a contract lobbyist.  We approach federal issues on a more ad hoc basis.

text: LA County departments are responsible for collecting current legislative information impacting operations within the department.  The county is interested in receiving any policies/processes you follow relating to ferreting out the most pertinent information and distributing it to the principals.  Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org.
title: Process for Collecting and Disseminating Legislative Information
